intro: Polygonum aviculare var. heterophyllum, commonly known as the variable knotweed, is a flowering plant species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves with hairy surfaces, and it produces small, clustered flowers in shades of red, pink, or white. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it a common weed in various habitats.
